contentrichtext.text: '''Ramon "Tiki" Fulwood''' (born May 23, 1944 in [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]]; died October 29, 1979) was a drummer for the [[funk]] bands [[Parliament (band)|Parliament]] and [[Funkadelic]]. He is a member of the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]], inducted in 1997 with fifteen other members of [[Parliament-Funkadelic]]. In the late 1960s, Fulwood was the house drummer for the Uptown Theater in [[Philadelphia]] when he met guitarist [[Eddie Hazel]]. Hazel and bassist [[Billy Bass Nelson]] were on tour as musical support for the [[doo wop]] vocal group [[The Parliaments]]. Hazel and Nelson convinced group leader [[George Clinton (funk musician)|George Clinton]] to add Fulwood to the group, where he replaced drummer Harvey McGee. Fulwood, Hazel, and Nelson formed the core of the [[The Parliaments]] musical backing group, which later became known as [[Funkadelic]]. Fulwood also played drums in the [[Tyrone Davis]] band between stints with P-Funk, and later was briefly employed by [[Miles Davis]]. Fulwood was officially dismissed from [[Parliament-Funkadelic]] in 1973 but did play and record sporadically with those groups in the following years. Fulwood fathered one child, Stuff Nicole Cleague, who resides in Buffalo, New York. She accepted his award at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1997 and was introduced by George Clinton. Fulwood died of stomach cancer in 1979. ==External links== *[http://www.duke.edu/~tmc/pfunk.html The Motherpage] * http://profile.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=user.viewprofile&friendid=363249325 ==References== * Liner notes to ''Music For Your Mother'' by Rob Bowman, 1992. {{P-Funk}} {{The Parliaments}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Fulwood, Tiki | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = May 23, 1944 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = October 29, 1979 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fulwood, Tiki}} [[Category:American funk drummers]] [[Category:P-Funk members]] [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:1979 deaths]] [[Category:People from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Deaths from stomach cancer]] {{US-drummer-stub}}
